intro: Heliotropium lasiocarpum, commonly known as the hairy fruit heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Mexico and Central America. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
